description: Terms of A000203 that are prime.
comments: Sorted and duplicates removed, this gives A023195.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,100
example: sigma(2) = 3, sigma(4) = 7, sigma(9) = 13 are the first three prime terms of A000203. Hence the sequence starts 3, 7, 13.
prog: (MAGMA) [ c: n in [1..1000000] | IsPrime(c) where c:=SumOfDivisors(n) ]; [From Klaus Brockhaus, Oct 21 2009](PARI) je=[]; for(n=1,1000000, if(isprime(sigma(n)),je=concat(je, sigma(n)))); je(PARI) { n=0; for (m=1, 10^9, if(isprime(a=sigma(m)), write("b062700.txt", n++, " ", a); if (n==100, break)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 09 2009]
crossrefs: Cf. A000203 (sigma(n), sum of divisors of n), A034885 (record values of sigma(n)), A023195 (prime numbers that are the sum of the divisors of some n), A100382 (record values of A062700).
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 11 2001
